clinical_study.brief_title: The Long-lasting Effects of Repetitive Neck Muscle Vibrations on Postural Disturbances in Standing Position in Chronic Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Long-lasting Effects of Repetitive Neck Muscle Vibrations on Postural Disturbances in Standing Position and on Spatial Frame Reference in Chronic Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: One of the causes of disability in patients suffering from a stroke is postural imbalance. Sensory stimulation improves the postural symmetry of the subject transitorily and they are thought to have an effect on the spatial frame of reference through a sensory recalibration. Studies have shown that sensory stimulation by vibration of neck muscles have an immediate effect on static balance and when walking. The objective of this preliminary study is to test the long-lasting effects of repetitive neck muscle vibrations on postural disturbances in standing position and on spatial frame reference in chronic patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The hypothesis of this study is that the proprioceptive repeated stimulation by vibration of neck muscles in the long term improved postural asymmetry in connection with the egocentric representation of body disorders.
The effect of vibration simultaneously on improving postural asymmetry and on improving markers of the perception of the body in space (LBA, SSA, Subjective Visual Vertical (SVV), Rod and frame) will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline Weight Bearing Asymmetry at Day 15
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and after the intervention program (Day 15)
primary_outcome.description: The primary evaluation criteria is the percentage of the Weight Bearing Asymmetry on the hemiparetic lower limb (WBA) calculated as the mean of 4 trys, each based on a 30 seconds duration with the two eyes open (OP) and then again with the two eyes closed. This evaluation is realized on a force platform.

secondary_outcome.measure: Haptic and visual Subjective Straight Ahead (SSA) test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days and 15 days after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The effect on spatial reference frame evaluated by haptic and visual Subjective Straight Ahead (SSA) test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days and 15 days after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The effect on spatial reference frame is evaluated by Subjective Visual Vertical (SVV) test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days and 15 days after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The effect on spatial reference frame is evaluated on Longitudinal Body Axis (LBA)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days and 15 days after the start of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The effect on spatial reference frame is evaluated by the Rod and Frame Test

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of patients' motor skills
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the end of the program
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of motor skills with simple motor tasks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of patients' sensitivity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the end of the program
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of superficial tact on the hemiplegic lower limb compared to the safe limb

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of patients' spasticity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the end of the program
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of spasticity with Ashworth Modified scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline of patients' functional capacity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the end of the program
secondary_outcome.description: Functional capacity is a composite index made of sensitivity test, motor scale and spasticity scale

intervention.description: The patients will undergo a program of 10 sessions of vibrations of the neck muscle, each of 10 minutes, during a period of 15 days at the rate of one session per day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult (age ≥ 18 years) under 80 years,
- Right or left unilateral supratentorial ischemic or hemorrhagic lesion
- The first symptomatic episode
- Stroke
- older than 12 months
- with or without hemianopsia
- with or without visuospatial hemineglect
- Standing balance ≥ 30 sec unaided
- Percentage of weight bearing asymmetry on the hemiplegic lower limb (on a force platform)
- Written informed consent of the patient or a member of his entourage (in the case of patients with motor difficulties)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Orthopaedic, rheumatologic, neurologic, vestibular or visual disorders affecting the distribution of the centre of pressure while standing on the force platform
- Visual disorder that does not allow assessment of the spatial frame of reference test
- Difficulty with understanding protocol procedures
